0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify shipment details against commercial invoices, certificates of origin, and other relevant documentation to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Communicate with importers, exporters, and other stakeholders to clarify discrepancies or resolve issues related to customs clearance.
Prepare and submit declarations to the relevant authorities, including Commercial Invoices, Bill of Lading, and other supporting documents.
Conduct research on tariffs, quotas, and regulations to ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
Negotiate with government agencies and suppliers to resolve issues related to customs duty, taxes, and fees.
Coordinate transportation and delivery arrangements between importers, exporters, and freight forwarders.
Review and analyze customs data to identify trends and opportunities for process improvement.
Collaborate with trade partners to establish and maintain trade agreements and partnerships.
Develop and implement strategies to mitigate risks associated with customs compliance and trade disputes.
Maintain accurate records of shipments, documentation, and communication with stakeholders.
Ensure timely and efficient customs clearance by meeting deadlines and processing shipments in accordance with regulations.
Prepare and present presentations to clients and stakeholders on customs procedures, regulations, and best practices.
Stay up-to-date with changes in laws, regulations, and industry standards related to customs brokerage and trade compliance.
Analyze and interpret import licenses, permits, and certificates required for specific shipments or products.
Assist clients with the preparation of compliance documentation, such as export licenses and COO.
Resolve disputes and issues related to customs clearance, including claims against shipping lines or other parties.
Coordinate with government agencies to resolve issues related to product inspections, testing, and certification.
Prepare and submit reports to clients on shipment status, delivery dates, and customs clearance outcomes.
Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers, exporters, and other stakeholders to ensure continued business growth and success.
Provide guidance and support to new employees or contractors in the customs brokerage process.
Manage and resolve claims related to customs duty, taxes, and fees paid by importers or exporters.
1: Design and implement comprehensive training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
Develop and deliver instructional content for new hires, employees, or specific teams, tailoring the learning experience to meet individual needs.
Analyze training program effectiveness using data-driven metrics, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes to optimize results.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create engaging and accurate training materials, leveraging multimedia formats and interactive elements as needed.
Conduct needs assessments to identify gaps in employee knowledge or skills, informing the development of targeted training initiatives.
Evaluate instructor performance, providing constructive feedback to enhance teaching methods and improve overall training quality.
Identify and pursue opportunities for training program expansion or renovation, staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging best practices.
Create and manage training budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain relationships with external training providers, contracting for high-quality training services that meet organizational needs.
Implement a training evaluation system, tracking participant feedback and survey results to inform future program development.
Oversee the integration of technology-enhanced learning solutions into existing training programs, ensuring seamless adoption and user-friendly interfaces.
2: Prepare ingredients for daily menu items, following nutrition guidelines and dietary restrictions.
Operate kitchen equipment, such as ovens, stoves, and blenders, to ensure efficient food preparation.
Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to health and safety standards.
Create visually appealing dishes that meet presentation expectations.
Monitor inventory levels and order supplies in a timely manner to minimize waste.
Supervise junior cooks and provide guidance on techniques, recipes, and kitchen procedures.
Test food quality and consistency, making adjustments as needed to ensure menu items meet standards.
Manage cash handling and processing transactions at the cafeteria or institution's dining area.
Develop and implement new recipes or menu items to cater to changing tastes and dietary preferences.
Conduct daily cleaning and sanitizing of kitchen surfaces, equipment, and utensils.
Communicate effectively with colleagues, management, and customers to ensure seamless service delivery.
Maintain accurate records of food production, inventory, and waste disposal for quality control and administrative purposes.
